newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan vegoil import down in July, seen steady.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan vegoil import down in July, seen steady.

text.p: Pakistan imported 65,978 tonnes of vegtable oils in July compared to 176,541 tonnes imported in June, traders Saulat Enterprises said on Thursday.

The oils imported in July were 42,444 tonnes of RBD palm oil, 2,410 tonnes of palm fatty acids, 4,499 tonnes of crude palm oil, 10,850 tonnes of soyoil, 3,020 tonnes of tallow and 2,755 tonnes of other palm oil derivatives.
In June, Pakistan imported 144,838 tonnes of RBD palm oil, 19,499 tonnes of soyoil, 4,190 tonnes palm fatty acids, 4,748 tonnes of crude palm oil and 3,266 tonnes of other palm oil drivatives.
"Imports fell as local production of edible oils were better than last year," dealer Kamran Siddiqui said.
He said imports might remain steady in August as the production season of sunflower oil, canola and rapeseed would come to an end.
He said cottonseed oil would hit the domestic market by the end of September and might again pull the imports down.
Pakistan imported 891,942 tonnes of vegoil in fiscal 1996/97 (July-June) compared to 1.143 million tonnes in 1995/96.
